actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on the Judiciary.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Commercial and Administrative Law.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Commercial and Administrative Law

official_title: To provide that certain regulations shall not take effect unless published in final form not later than 18 months after the date of publication of general notice of proposed rulemaking.

summary.text: Regulatory Efficiency Act - Prohibits a covered regulation from taking effect unless it is published in final form within 18 months after the date of publication of a general notice of proposed rulemaking for the regulation. Defines "covered regulation" as the whole or a part of an agency statement of general or particular applicability and future effect designed to implement, interpret, or prescribe law or policy, other than such a statement to carry out an agency's routine administrative function.

titles.title: To provide that certain regulations shall not take effect unless published in final form not later than 18 months after the date of publication of general notice of proposed rulemaking.
